text:
Does MLJ have a way to do PCA?
Preferably one that doesn’t touch python,
and that does support missing values

elements.text:
Does MLJ have a way to do PCA?
Preferably one that doesn’t touch python,
and that does support missing values

text:
looks so:

```
julia> models("PCA")
3-element Vector{NamedTuple{(:name, :package_name, :is_supervised, :docstring, :hyperparameter_ranges, :hyperparameter_types, :hyperparameters, :implemented_methods, :is_pure_julia, :is_wrapper, :load_path, :package_license, :package_url, :package_uuid, :prediction_type, :supports_class_weights, :supports_online, :supports_weights, :input_scitype, :target_scitype, :output_scitype), T} where T<:Tuple}:
 (name = KernelPCA, package_name = MultivariateStats, ... )
 (name = PCA, package_name = MultivariateStats, ... )
 (name = PPCA, package_name = MultivariateStats, ... )```

elements.text:
julia> models("PCA")
3-element Vector{NamedTuple{(:name, :package_name, :is_supervised, :docstring, :hyperparameter_ranges, :hyperparameter_types, :hyperparameters, :implemented_methods, :is_pure_julia, :is_wrapper, :load_path, :package_license, :package_url, :package_uuid, :prediction_type, :supports_class_weights, :supports_online, :supports_weights, :input_scitype, :target_scitype, :output_scitype), T} where T<:Tuple}:
 (name = KernelPCA, package_name = MultivariateStats, ... )
 (name = PCA, package_name = MultivariateStats, ... )
 (name = PPCA, package_name = MultivariateStats, ... )

text:
its what i am using right now.

Sadly that doesn’t support missings.

text: ah, I think I  think I hallucinated a "not missing" in your sentence :D

elements.text: ah, I think I  think I hallucinated a "not missing" in your sentence :D

text: <@U6A936746> What algorithm for dealing with the missing values would you like to see implemented? I’m assuming you want something fancier than simple applying a pre-processing step to impute?

elements.text: What algorithm for dealing with the missing values would you like to see implemented? I’m assuming you want something fancier than simple applying a pre-processing step to impute?

text:
The two algorithms I am aware of is PPCA, which is mentioned in the original paper by Bishop et al.
(though it is just a reference to another paper, and a figure showing it works)
See <https://github.com/JuliaStats/MultivariateStats.jl/issues/138>
Which has links

and low rank methods, which idk is doing some manifold trick? It all looks like regularized matrix factoring to me.
Low Rank Models.jl does have PCA.
But it is very confusing to me as to how to actually use it.
